title: James Bond star Susie Venner tips Idris Elba to be next 007
text:
Could Idris be the next James Bond? (Picture: WireImage/Getty Images)

James Bond star Susie Venner has revealed that Idris Elba ‘could work’ as the next actor to take on the role of the spy.

The actress starred as a Russian agent in The Spy Who Loved Me, the 10th installment in the James Bond franchise, and is well known for her romantic encounter with the late Roger Moore’s Bond, with the two sharing a passionate scene together.

Now, Susie has revealed that she thinks Idris is ‘strong and beautiful’, and he could be an ideal candidate for the role of 007, following the end of current actor Daniel Craig’s tenure.

Speaking at the launch of the London Cabaret Club’s Bond-themed London Never Dies event, she said: ‘Maybe, that could work. But it’s still got to stay traditionally British.

‘He’s very strong and he’s beautiful, so that could work.’

And when asked if she still watches the previous Bond films, and if she intends on watching the next installment, No Time To Die, she replied: ‘Yes I will and I do. I’ve watched every single James Bond.’

However, Susie is opposed to a woman taking over the role, believing that it would ‘change the whole storyline’ from the original book series by Ian Fleming.

‘There are amazing actresses around that could play a strong role like 007, for instance Jodie Comer is fantastic,’ she continued.

Susie starred alongside the late Roger Moore in the James Bond classic The Spy Who Loved Me (Picture: Twentieth Century Fox)

‘But I really don’t think I want James Bond movies changed to that degree. It’s changing the whole storyline that Ian Fleming wrote and I love the tradition and history of it all, it means so much, the storylines and characters reflect the time of when it was written.’

In the meantime, it has been announced that the next James Bond movie, No Time To Die, will receive a slightly earlier release than originally planned, after being pushed forward from 3 April to 2 April 2020.

The movie is set to be the 25th in the franchise and Daniel Craig’s final role as the titular character.
